course-info.course-head-description: The language used to build the structure of websites. Learn how to add text, images, links and more to your website.

chapter-1.chapter-description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is a markup language used to create web pages that are served by web servers and displayed by web clients, such as web browsers. It defines the structure and content of a web page using tags and attributes, which are interpreted by web browsers to display text, images, links, and other multimedia content. HTML is a key component of the World Wide Web and is used in conjunction with other technologies, such as CSS and JavaScript, to create dynamic and interactive web pages.
chapter-paragraphs: Every website needs a server to run on. A web server is a computer that is connected to the internet and is running a web server software. The web server listens for incoming requests from web browsers, retrieves the requested resources, and sends them back to the client over the internet. Web servers typically use HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) as the primary communication protocol to transfer data between the server and client.

A web client is a software or application that requests and displays web content from a web server. It communicates with the web server using HTTP and sends requests for web pages or resources such as images, videos, or scripts. The most common web client is a web browser, such as Google Chrome, Firefox, or Safari, but web clients can also be other software programs or applications that communicate with web servers to retrieve and display web content.

chapter-2.chapter-description: For a website you need to create a document with the .html extension. This document will contain all the HTML code for your website. The main document is usually called index.html. You can create this document in any text editor or IDE (e.g. Notepad, Sublime Text, Visual Studio Code, WebStorm, etc.).
chapter-paragraphs: Since HTML 5, every html file should start with <!DOCTYPE html>. This tells the browser to expect an html document. After that the <html> tag follows. This tag tells the browser that the content inside is HTML code. Inside the <html> tag you will find the <head> and <body> tags. While the <head> tag contains information about the document, such as the title of the document the <body> tag contains the content of the document, such as text, images, links, etc.
IMPORTANT: Almost every opening tag should have a closing tag. For example, <html> has the closing tag </html>.
